intro: Tabernaemontana guangdongensis, commonly known as Guangdong starry nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has smooth, lance-shaped leaves and produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though care must be taken due to its poisonous nature.
